critique: The document is an executive order regarding the prosecution of war crimes. As the author, the primary emotions I want to elicit are a sense of justice and resolve. There may also be an element of fear for those who committed the crimes. The tone is formal and authoritative, reflecting the gravity of the situation. The language is precise and legalistic, emphasizing the seriousness of the matter. The context is the aftermath of a major war, where accountability is paramount. Initial scores: Joy: 1 (not applicable), Sadness: 2 (acknowledging the war), Anger: 6 (towards the perpetrators), Fear: 5 (for the consequences of war crimes), Disgust: 6 (at the nature of the crimes), Surprise: 1 (not applicable). Revised scores: Joy: 1, Sadness: 2, Anger: 7, Fear: 6, Disgust: 7, Surprise: 1
